I am writing some unit test classes for a project I'm working on.  I
use Ap=
ache Commons Logging as a wrapper for Log4J but I keep getting
the followin=
g error messages when I run the tests:

log4j:WARN No appenders could be fo=
und for logger
(com.panoramicsolutions.ffl.model.HibernateConfiguration).
l=
og4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.

 file is as follows:

I have tried the following to get this working:

1) i=
ncluding log4j.properties on the classpath
2) removing it from the classpat=
h and specifying
-Dlog4j.properties=3D<full path to file> on the Java comma=
nd line

I also had to edit the Junit excluded.properties file to exclude
o=
rg.apache.commons.logging.* to get this far.

In the classes I define the L=
og variables as follows:

private static Log logger =3D Logger.getLog(<clas=
sname>.class);

This is really doing my head in as I can't see the log mess=
ages to
help debug a problem in the Hibernate configuration.  Despite spend=
ing
hours searching the web and newsgroups for an answer I can't find one.

Can anyone help?

Thanks,

Charles.
